summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking and obtaining approval for a 'friendly subpoena' to a real estate attorney who handled Ghislaine Maxwell's purchase of a New Hampshire property in 2019. The documents are sought for the financial investigation into Maxwell, including potential ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The email is addressed to her, and her approval is required to issue the subpoena. She approves the request.

persons.name: Hudkins
persons.context: The attorney who handled the purchase of Ghislaine Maxwell's New Hampshire property in 2019. She reached out to the FBI after Maxwell's arrest and offered assistance, requesting a formal subpoena before providing non-privileged documents.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the financial investigation. The subpoena seeks records related to her purchase of a New Hampshire property, where she was later arrested.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the investigation into Maxwell's finances, specifically regarding potential financial ties and efforts to buy her silence.

connections.description: The investigation is examining financial ties between Maxwell and Epstein, including potential efforts by Epstein to buy Maxwell's silence.
Hudkins is identified as the real estate attorney who handled Maxwell's purchase of a New Hampshire property in 2019.
Strauss, as the U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the legal investigation and prosecution of Maxwell, approving investigative steps like this subpoena.

events.title: Purchase of New Hampshire Property
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell purchases a property in New Hampshire, with attorney Hudkins handling the real estate transaction.

events.title: Request for Subpoena Approval
events.description: The Maxwell investigation team requests approval from U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss to issue a 'friendly subpoena' to real estate attorney Hudkins.

events.title: Subpoena Approval Granted
events.description: Audrey Strauss approves the issuance of the friendly subpoena to attorney Hudkins for non-privileged documents related to Maxwell's property purchase.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was investigating the financial circumstances of Ghislaine Maxwell's 2019 purchase of a New Hampshire property.
The real estate attorney (Hudkins) who handled the purchase proactively contacted the FBI after Maxwell's arrest and offered assistance, but requested a formal subpoena.
The investigation sought to uncover any financial ties between Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, including potential efforts by Epstein to buy Maxwell's silence.
The subpoena was characterized as 'friendly' and sought only non-privileged documents, requiring approval from the U.S. Attorney but not from the Office's Professional Staff Enforcement Unit (PSEU).
The property in New Hampshire was the location where Ghislaine Maxwell was later arrested.
